article: A young student was one day taking a walk with a professor, who was commonly  _  the students' friend. As they went  _  , they saw lying in the path a pair of old  _  , which they supposed to belong to a poor man who was employed in a  _  close by. The student turned to the professor, saying, "Let's play the man a  _  : We will hide his shoes, and  _  ourselves behind those bushes, and wait to see his  _  when he cannot find them." "My young friend," answered the professor, "we should never  _  ourselves at the  _  of the poor. But you are  _  , and may give yourself a much greater  _  by means of the poor man. Put a coin into each shoe, and then we will hide ourselves and  _  how the discovery affects him." The student did so, and they both placed themselves behind the bushes. The poor man soon finished his work, and came  _  the field to the path  _  he had left his coat and shoes. While  putting on  his coat he slipped his foot into one of his shoes; but feeling  _  , he stopped down to feel  _  it was, and found the coin. Astonishment and wonder were seen upon his face. He now put the money into his pocket, but his  _  was doubled on finding the other coin. He fell upon his knees, looked up to heaven and uttered aloud a fervent thanksgiving, in which he  _  his wife, sick and helpless, and his children without bread. The student stood there deeply  _  , and his eyes filled with tears.
